channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How did Tucker Carlson become one of the far right's most influential voices?
item.description: Writer Jason Zengerle says Carlson had the foresight to see Trump's potential in 2015. Now he's someone the president "definitely listens to." Zengerl...

item.title: A crackdown on immigration is leading to a sharp drop in U.S. population growth
item.description: A sharp drop in net immigration has led to a slowdown in U.S. population growth. The Census Bureau says the population grew only about half as fast in...

item.title: Scientists shed new light on the brain's role in heart attack
item.description: Researchers discovered a feedback loop between nerve cells, the immune system and the heart. They think it shows promise as a target for future therap...

item.title: Spain Offers Undocumented Migrants a Legal Way to Stay
item.description: The measure, unexpectedly approved, comes as other countries are cracking down on immigration.

item.title: Texas Moves to Curtail Visas for Skilled Foreign Workers
item.description: Gov. Greg Abbott said the state would investigate public agencies and universities that employ those with H-1B visas, a program the Trump administrati...

item.title: U.S. Population Growth Slows Sharply as Immigration Numbers Plunge
item.description: New census estimates show the effects of dropping birthrates and President Trump’s anti-immigration policies. As his term continues, immigration is ex...

item.title: Bari Weiss Urges CBS News to Think Like a ‘Start-Up’
item.description: “We are not producing a product enough people want,” Ms. Weiss told employees at her first all-staff meeting at the network.

item.title: 'Fireworks' wins Caldecott, Newbery is awarded to 'All the Blues in the Sky'
item.description: The best books for children and young adults were awarded the country's top honors by the American Library Association on Monday.

item.title: Ex-FIFA president Sepp Blatter joins those calling for boycott of World Cup in U.S.
item.description: Former FIFA president Sepp Blatter is backing a proposed fan boycott of World Cup matches in the United States because of the conduct of President Tru...

item.title: Former French Senator Convicted of Drugging a Colleague, Intending to Assault Her
item.description: The trial took on special resonance in France, a year after a court found Dominique Pelicot and dozens of other men guilty of raping Gisèle Pelicot wh...

item.title: How Iran Crushed an Uprising
item.description: A visual investigation by The New York Times shows the breadth and ferocity of the regime’s crackdown across the country.

item.title: Trump Vows Higher Tariffs for South Korea Months After Trade Deal
item.description: President Trump said Seoul was not moving fast enough to implement the agreement, which calls for South Korea to invest billions in the United States.

item.title: Spain Offers Undocumented Migrants a Legal Way to Stay
item.description: The measure, unexpectedly approved, comes as other countries are cracking down on immigration.

item.title: Microsoft Pledged to Save Water. In the A.I. Era, It Expects Water Use to Soar.
item.description: Driven by the artificial intelligence frenzy, Microsoft is internally projecting that water use at its data centers will more than double by 2030 from...
